content.html:
↳ In-reply-to ¬ª Learn to use email with git! Patch Workflows - Ry‚Äôs Git Tutorial - RyPress -- Another good blog post on working with Git patches via Email as well as applying them. -- The key point (I think) is that you need to grab the entire contents of email email in order in order to pipe the contents into git am - -- Hmmm ü§î -- I think we can do better than this...

@justamoment I agree, the patch workflow is a bit complicated (especially for new users) and I find it a bit unfriendly too. Having to switch from an Email client to Command-line just to manage reviews and applying patches kind of sucks IMO. ‚Äì Some nice way to manage incoming changes and communicate reviews and easily applying those changes would be nicer. ‚Äì I even had this stupid idea of pushing patches to a special endpoint that create a new Twt in a per-repo Twtxt feed with a link to the ‚Äúpatch‚Äù (via a Web UI) and then you can communicate feedback over your own feeds ü§£ ‚Äì Finally a ‚Äúpatch‚Äù is either #approved or #rejected and patch manager can look for those tags in the thread and deal with the UI appropriately.

I'm not sure yet how far I'll go, but its fun anyway. üòÖ Who knows, maybe this will become the thing I talked about ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è #git #hosting #server #thingy
